page.title: 18The Workhouse At Ore
page.content: A workhouse was built in 1836 at Ore.This meant that the unsightly and distressing poor houses could disappear from Hastings and St.Leonards which were fashionable places in those days.The workhouse was built in what was then Cackle Sreet and what is now Frederick Road.Much later an extension was built on the other side of the road and these eventually became part of St.Helens Hospital.(This is a hospital without a casualty unit,dealing mainly with women and children's surgical cases and geriatric care.) In 1873 a report said that the dining room in the workhouse was very low and could be offensive.An open sewer ran along the bottom of the workhouse garden and was a danger to the inhabitants and to the residents in the neighbourhood.
